segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, and it’s just getting worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right in it, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is just pouring out like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting soaked, and the cabinets are probably ruined by now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why no one has turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are too busy with the cookies, and the woman is just drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like no one cares about the mess they’re making.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for whoever has to clean this up later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s just a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone does something before it gets even worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just such a frustrating scene to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
